definition: to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball

sentences.english: You've been getting the fourth, the fifth, and the sixth implementation of a good idea funded.
sentences.chinese: 而是第四手甚至更后的，一个新想法都被老调重弹了。

sentences.english: Now he's started on his hobbyhorse.
sentences.chinese: 现在他又开始老调重弹了。

sentences.english: That spokesman is striking up the same old tune.
sentences.chinese: 那个发言人又在老调重弹。

sentences.english: Was this just more of the same or something new?
sentences.chinese: 这究竟是老调重弹还是一种新情况呢？

sentences.english: Don't get him started on his hobbyhorse.
sentences.chinese: 不要让他又开始他的老调重弹。

sentences.english: That's a string that's been harped on many times before.
A renewal of those worries isn't the only problem currently facing Huawei.
sentences.chinese: 华为目前面对的问题不单只这个老调重弹的担忧。

sentences.english: The opposition ridiculed the government's proposals, saying they often have nothing new.
sentences.chinese: 反对派揶揄政府的建议，说成是老调重弹。

definition: an old observation (idiom)/a truism/banal comments
replaying the same old tunes (idiom); conservative, unoriginal and discredited/to keep harping on about the same old stuff
cliché/commonplace/truism/stereotype
to raise the same topic
to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
old wine in a new bottle (idiom)
the same old stuff
argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
to digress/to get sidetracked/to go off on a tangent
(Tw) unoriginal/hackneyed/(of a joke) old
political correctness/politically correct
to replay string instrument/fig. to harp on the same string/to raise the same old topic again
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
